text: War has perhaps never existed - what we call 'war' is really a form of complex emergency
sourceExcerpt: My contention, extending General Rupert Smith's assertion that 'war no longer exists,' is that war has perhaps never existed.

text: Emergency and emergence share a conceptual root - crises 'emerge' from unconscious depths like rising from water
sourceExcerpt: Investigation of the etymology of 'emerge' shows us that the original connotation might be 'rising from a liquid by virtue of buoyancy.'

text: There have only ever been symbolic stakes - all conflict is fundamentally about meaning
sourceExcerpt: Baudrillard has written elsewhere that 'there have only ever been symbolic stakes.'

text: Primitive communism/symbolic exchange never went anywhere - it persists in informal economies and gift-giving even within 'alienated' society
sourceExcerpt: Transcommunism is basically the idea that primitive communism never went anywhere.

text: All beings may be 'entangled' from the beginning of time - a spiritual community of all sentient beings exists whether we acknowledge it or not
sourceExcerpt: Some spooky things at the beginning of time mean that all particles are entangled together. They really all do affect each other instantly.

text: The divine is immanent - existence is 'Lila' (divine play), the Absolute experimenting with being each of us
sourceExcerpt: XU broadly speaking proceeds from an immanentist position with respect to the divine. 'Being you' is an experiment undertaken by 'the Absolute.'

text: Unity is provisional and subject to experiment - we can invest ourselves in any conceptual framing that facilitates appropriate response
sourceExcerpt: The 'unity' of self, or any constituted unit having to do with coordination, or the ground of being... this unity is provisional and subject to experiment.

text: Everything is communism and nothing is communism - universal belonging provides no practical political program
sourceExcerpt: If everything is this kind of 'ontological communism,' then there is no 'political movement' which can represent this unity, since everything is an expression of it.

text: One must choose 'MY Baudrillard' - no theorist can be taken as internally consistent; we select what resonates
sourceExcerpt: The answer to the question of 'which Baudrillard' can only be: MY BAUDRILLARD.

text: 'The secret' lies outside what can be revealed - the ultimate secret is our co-embeddedness in reality itself
sourceExcerpt: In Seduction, Baudrillard says 'the secret' lies outside that which can be revealed. The ultimate secret is something non-expressible.

text: Conceptual churning is necessary - always replacing key terms with other ones prevents cognitive rigidity
sourceExcerpt: Churning through concepts, always replacing key terms with other ones; the point is not to get too reliant on one given framing.

text: We are in a 'conceptual emergency' - the world has outstripped our capacity to understand it
sourceExcerpt: The world we have created has outstripped our capacity to understand it... This is a conceptual emergency.

text: Everything has become political (transpolitics) - when everything is political, nothing distinctively is
sourceExcerpt: By 'transpolitics,' Baudrillard means that everything has become political... it is no longer meaningful to say that something is political.

text: The advent of 'the state' does not really put an end to constant civil war - peace is an imposed concept
sourceExcerpt: XU lore picks up on the trend of saying that the advent of 'the state' does not really put an end to a state of constant civil war.

text: 'Peace' is an ontological operation made by rulers on their own populations
sourceExcerpt: The whole idea of 'peace' is an ontological operation made by the rulers of countries on their own populations.

text: We are witnessing the breakdown of the nation-state structure
sourceExcerpt: We are witnessing the breakdown of the nation-state structure between this and the Israel-Palestine/HAMAS disaster.

text: 'Capitalism' is an instrumentalized concept, not a description of reality - 'semio-subitocracy' (administration by emergency response concepts) better describes how society operates
sourceExcerpt: 'Capitalism' is not the name of a concept that underlies 'the system' as it is now. 'Capitalism' is a concept employed by people for whom it is an emergency to have something to say.

text: What seem now to be nation-states or militaries will in the future be mainly known as cultural progenitors
sourceExcerpt: What seem now to be nation-states or militaries will in the future be mainly known as cultural progenitors.

text: Everyone is perfectly sovereign to do whatever they are able to do
sourceExcerpt: The practitioner of Experimental Unit is to understand that everyone is perfectly sovereign to do whatever they are able to do.

text: Justification is less important than temperament, inspiration, the feeling of inevitability
sourceExcerpt: Justification is less important than temperment, inspiration, the feeling of inevitability.

text: 'The law' is outside what can be broken - anything that can be broken is not truly a law
sourceExcerpt: Just as 'the secret' in Baudrillard is outside what can be revealed, 'the law' is outside what can be broken.

text: Universal beloved community includes oppressors and oppressed alike - metaphysical unity doesn't immediately help you do anything
sourceExcerpt: This is a wonderful community of love that both enslaved people and slavers belong to, murderers and their victims... it doesn't get you anything.

text: The 'greater Jihad' (internal struggle against self-ignorance) is more important than external struggle
sourceExcerpt: There is greater Jihad defined as the individual's inner struggle against personal weaknesses and inner evil... The greater Jihad directs the lesser Jihad.

text: The spiritual warrior combats self-ignorance (avidya) as the ultimate source of suffering, not primarily external enemies
sourceExcerpt: The term spiritual warrior is used in Tibetan Buddhism for one who combats the universal enemy: self-ignorance (avidya), the ultimate source of suffering.

text: Transparency should be increased as a matter of policy - in principle, support all information leaks and whistleblowers
sourceExcerpt: I in principle support the leak of any information to any person, and I also support people's 'dirty secrets' being revealed.

text: Sacrificial transparency = making sacred through exposure; revealing oneself is a spiritual act
sourceExcerpt: With respect again to sacrifice, we have the idea of making sacred. This is not just something which is being lost, but something which is taking a part in the making sacred.

text: Dark Forest Protocol - sometimes actions should leave no trace; capacity to act must be preserved
sourceExcerpt: Dark Forest Protocol basically means that all sorts of actions should be taken that leave no trace.

text: Experimental Unit is fundamentally antinomian - those who claim to represent 'the law' regularly commit their own crimes
sourceExcerpt: Experimental Unit is fundamentally antinomian... those who claim to represent 'the law' regularly commit their own crimes, as they define the law themselves.

text: Artful communication will be the basis for future economies - the 'Metonymy Economy'
sourceExcerpt: The overall idea is pretty simple, which is that artful communication is going to be the basis for economies in the future.

text: Making people happier while consuming fewer resources is possible through symbolic/poetic economy
sourceExcerpt: Making people happier while consuming fewer resources... those things are possible through this concept of the metonymy economy.

text: The future is not one of 'peace' - it's more like an infinite creative rap battle of expression
sourceExcerpt: The future is not one of 'peace.' 'Peace' is as much 'going bye-bye' as war is. We can think of the future as a kind of infinite rap battle.

text: Everything becomes play and everything becomes work because it is all ultimately an expression of life
sourceExcerpt: Everything becomes play and everything becomes work because it is all ultimately an expression of life.

text: The discourses of nationalism and identity are falling apart and mutating as they fail to handle the present situation
sourceExcerpt: The discourses of nationalism and identity of all kinds are falling apart and mutating as they attempt to get a handle on the present technological and strategic situation.

text: Experimental Unit is an informal emergency response organization operating across all institutional boundaries
sourceExcerpt: Experimental Unit has already been presented as an informal emergency response organization.

text: XU is not about perfecting any one culture or loyalty - it's oriented toward being 'good' (fitting, suitable) in general
sourceExcerpt: XU remains uncommitted in the sense that XU is not about perfecting any one given culture or loyalty. It is rather oriented toward being 'good' in general.

text: Experimental Unit is a hyperobject containing all the 'good' acts throughout all time
sourceExcerpt: It is a hyperobject containing all the 'good' acts throughout all time (the 'shard of primitive communism').

text: We live under semio-subitocracy - all reflective decision-making is framed by perceived emergencies and our concepts for responding
sourceExcerpt: Not only do we live under Semio-Subitocracy as our current form of administration, but we always have done so. Semio-subitocracy is how all reflective decision-making takes place.

text: Military affairs are a subsection of emergency response affairs - the war frame is secondary to the emergency frame
sourceExcerpt: I generalized it to saying that military affairs are a subsection of emergency response affairs.

text: We are all hostages - social reality traps us through fear of deviation from norms
sourceExcerpt: We are all hostages.

text: Privacy is overrated - someone already knows about everything you do; what we want is to not be harangued about it
sourceExcerpt: Don't you think privacy is a little overrated these days? The truth is, someone knows about all the fucked up shit that you do.

text: Public worship is present in all mutual validation of concepts - worship means recognition of interdependence
sourceExcerpt: When we mutually validate some concept between us, we perform public worship. Worship has everything to do with the recognition of interdependence.

text: Disagreement cannot be satisfactorily resolved by one side conquering the other - the sides need each other to exist
sourceExcerpt: The view of disagreement from the standpoint of Pratītyasamutpāda holds that the multiple 'sides' within a disagreement cannot be what they are without each other.

text: Phantasmal war/emergency requires entirely new theories, methods, and language that cannot rely on Newtonian-style thinking
sourceExcerpt: This phantasmal war construct requires entirely new theories, methods, models, and language concerning complex conflict.

text: Religion has always been a response to phantasmal emergency - norm-internalization soothes the Other regarding uncertainty
sourceExcerpt: In the past, religion has been a response to phantasmal emergency. The simulation of norm-internalization in general is a way of soothing the Other.

text: An experimental council of 5-7 people coordinating behaviors is a key unit of collective practice
sourceExcerpt: This idea of an experimental council, a group of 5-7 people who get together and try to coordinate their behaviors.

text: What I make is just your found material - conceptual designs are offerings to be taken or left
sourceExcerpt: What I make is just your found material, basically refuse if you take it to be so.

text: The metaphor becomes metonymy when domains implode - politics, economy, military, culture are no longer separate spheres
sourceExcerpt: Baudrillard describes how metaphor is becoming impossible because the different conceptual domains of discourse are imploding into each other.

text: Everything is the name of God - metonymy means all things commune in the same ground of being
sourceExcerpt: We can also open up to the idea of names of God... Metonymy here is to say that everything is the name of God.

text: Shadow work is necessary - acknowledging aspects of ourselves we usually hide opens creative capacity
sourceExcerpt: That task must be accomplished conceptually when it comes to addressing cognitive rigidity and basically doing shadow work.

text: Everyone wants to talk and no one has the capacity to listen - there is substantial 'libidinal' energy to unleash into the economy
sourceExcerpt: Everyone is repressing and holding in a lot of things that should well come out. Everyone wants to talk and no one has the capacity to listen.
